member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.DropAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to sign a method, which can return a list, which in turn is used to fill a dropdown element of the corresponding PropertyGrid's property item.
member.remarks:
Implementers of Plug-Ins who wish to implement XML elements, can extend their design time support by adding this attribute to exact one method. Each property, which has the UITypeConverterDropSelection (in UI assembly) type converter attribute attached, will use that method as a callback to fill the appropriate list.
The behavior can be extended by inheriting from this and the UITypeConverterDropSelection class and implementing additional constructor overloads, which the derived classes can use to start different action apart from default one.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IEffectiveStyle.cursor
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the type of cursor to display as the mouse pointer moves over the object.

list.item: Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle, indicating that the page can be scrolled in any direction.
Default. Browser determines which cursor to display based on the current context.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them, indicating that the item/column can be resized horizontally.
Platform-dependent default cursor; usually an arrow.
Hand with the first finger pointing up, as when the user moves the pointer over a link.
Arrow with question mark, indicating help is available.
Crossed arrows, indicating something is to be moved.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Hand with a small circle with a line through it, indicating that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Circle with a line through it, indicating that the requested action will not be carried out.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Hand with the first finger pointing up, as when the user moves the pointer over a link. Identical to hand.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrow with an hourglass next to it, indicating that a process is running in the background. User interaction with the page is unaffected.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them, indicating that the item/row can be resized vertically.

Internet Explorer 6 and later. Cursor is defined by the author, using a custom Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), such as url('mycursor.cur'). Cursors of type .CUR and .ANI are the only supported cursor types.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Editable vertical text, indicated by a horizontal I-bar.
Hourglass or watch, indicating that the program is busy and the user should wait.
Arrows, indicating an edge is to be moved; the asterisk (*) can be N, NE, NW, S, SE, SW, E, or Wâ€”each representing a compass direction.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.ClipStyle
member.summary: Defines which part of a positioned object is visible.
member.remarks: Top, right, bottom, and left specify length values, any of which can be replaced by auto, leaving that side not clipped. The value of top specifies that everything above this value on the Y axis (with 0 at the top) is clipped. The value of right specifies that everything above this value on the X axis (with 0 at the left) is clipped. The value of bottom specifies that everything below this value on the Y axis (with 0 at the top) is clipped. The value of left specifies that everything to the left of this value on the X axis (with 0 at the left) is clipped.

member.summary: This interfaces handles attached binary behaviors.

member.summary: Get behaviors

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.AddBehavior(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IBaseBehavior,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a specific behavior to the element and give them a rectangle measures.
member.remarks: This is used because binary behaviors can only get visible for elements having a rectangle format. This is done by adding style-width and style-height. Remark: Removing behavior will remove the style attributes, but doing not so will remain the attributes in the document after saving. If the element has already set the attributes, they will not change, even if they are set in a way that makes the element unvisible.
member.param: The behavior object
Width in Pixel
Height in Pixel

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.AddBehavior(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IBaseBehavior)
member.summary: Adds a specific behavior to this element and stores the behavior cookie.
member.remarks: To use a binary behavior create a class which inherits directly from class. Overwrite the Draw method to give the behavior a specific graphical context and Name property to have unique name if multiple behavior are attached the same time.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.HasBehavior
member.summary: Has at least one behavior attached.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.HasBehavior(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IBaseBehavior)
member.summary: The specified behavior is attached to this element.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.GetBehaviorNames
member.summary: Returns the names of the instances of all attached behaviors.
member.returns: Collection of names of the attched behavior instances.
member.remarks: Behaviors are supposed to have unique names. This methods returns the active instances with unique names. Behaviors which break the rule may not appear correctly.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.RemoveBehavior
member.summary: Remove all behaviors from element.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElementBehavior.RemoveBehavior(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IBaseBehavior)
member.summary: Remove the given behavior from element.
member.remarks: If the behavior has forced setting the width and/or height of the element to beeing displayed this method will remove these style attributes. If other parts of the app uses tese values to you must assure that the previously set values are reset.
member.param: The behavior that was previously attached.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop
member.summary: This class is a wrapper to MSHTML.
member.remarks:
This class contains all COM related definitions, like interfaces, enumerations, Win32 API calls, structures and classes to help the interfaces to get implemented and all GUIDs to find the right entry points in the MSHTML.DLL.
The interface definitions does not contain the whole MSHTML but the ones we need to use the NetRix functions.

member.summary: MSHTML does not enable selection of the text in the form.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.DISABLE_HELP_MENU
member.summary: Not supported in NetRix

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.NO3DBORDER
member.summary: MSHTML does not use 3-D borders on any frames or framesets. To turn the border off on only the outer frameset use DOCHOSTUIFLAG_NO3DOUTERBORDER

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.SCROLL_NO
member.summary: MSHTML does not have scroll bars.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.DISABLE_SCRIPT_INACTIVE
member.summary: MSHTML does not execute any script until fully activated.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.OPENNEWWIN
member.summary: Not supported in NetRix

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.DISABLE_OFFSCREEN
member.summary: Not supported in NetRix

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.FLAT_SCROLLBAR
member.summary: Uses flat scroll bars for any UI it displays.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.DIV_BLOCKDEFAULT
member.summary: Inserts the div tag if a return is entered in edit mode. Without this flag, MSHTML will use the p tag.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.ACTIVATE_CLIENTHIT_ONLY
member.summary: Becomes UI active if the mouse is clicked in the client area of the window. It does not become UI active if the mouse is clicked on a non-client area, such as a scroll bar.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.USE_WINDOWLESS_SELECTCONTROL
member.summary: Causes MSHTML to use the Document Object Model (DOM) to create native "windowless" select controls that can be visually layered under other elements.
member.remarks: This is ON by default and cannot be changed in Netrix' object model.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.USE_WINDOWED_SELECTCONTROL
member.summary: Causes MSHTML to create standard Microsoft Win32 "windowed" select and drop-down controls.
member.remarks: This is OFF by default and cannot be changed in Netrix' object model.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DOCHOSTUIFLAG.DPI_AWARE
member.summary: Causes layout engine to calculate document pixels as 96 dots per inch (dpi). Normally, a document pixel is the same size as a screen pixel. This flag is equivalent to setting the FEATURE_96DPI_PIXEL feature control key on a per-host basis.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DVASPECT
member.summary: Specifies the desired data or view aspect of the object when drawing or getting data.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DVASPECT.DVASPECT_CONTENT
member.summary: A representation of an object that lets that object be displayed as an embedded object inside a container. This value is typically specified for compound document objects. The presentation can be provided for the screen or printer.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DVASPECT.DVASPECT_THUMBNAIL
member.summary: A thumbnail representation of an object that lets that object be displayed in a browsing tool. The thumbnail is approximately a 120 by 120 pixel, 16-color (recommended), device-independent bitmap potentially wrapped in a metafile.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DVASPECT.DVASPECT_ICON
member.summary: An iconic representation of an object.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.DVASPECT.DVASPECT_DOCPRINT
member.summary: A representation of an object on the screen as though it were printed to a printer using the Print command from the File menu. The described data may represent a sequence of pages.

member.summary: This enumeration returns the names and values of the possible values used for the "size" attribute of "font" tag.
member.remarks:
If a dialog applies to CSS "font-size" and HTML font tag with size attribute you must think about the relation between the named parameters. The x-small in CSS does not correspond exactly to the value 2 in HTML, whereas HTML parameter "7" has no direct counterpart in CSS.
A full description about the implementation details can be found here: http://style.cleverchimp.com/font_size_intervals/altintervals.html.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.BaseBehavior.HitTestPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called by the renderer to retrieve a value that specifies whether a point is contained in a rendering behavior.
member.remarks: The renderer calls this method when calls are made to such methods as elementFromPoint or componentFromPoint that need to determine how a point relates to the elements in a document's object tree. The behavior then can determine how the element to which it is attached handles events. In particular, the plPartID parameter enables a rendering behavior to assign identification numbers for different parts of the behavior. The value of this parameter is stored as an event object property. For example, a resizing behavior could return a unique value in plPartID for each of its sizing handles. The method could then query the event object for this value to determine in which direction to resize an element as the user drags the sizing handle. When the behavior is rendered below the flow layer of an element, the plPartID returned by this method is not passed to the event object. Instead, the event object contains information provided by the objects in the flow layer, above the behavior. The lZOrder member of the structure specified by GetPainterInfo determines whether the behavior is above or below the flow layer.
member.param: x of point clicked relative to the top-left corner of the element to which the behavior is attached.
y of point clicked relative to the top-left corner of the element to which the behavior is attached.
Receives a number identifying which part of the behavior has been hit
member.returns: TRUE if the point is contained in the element to which the rendering behavior is attached, or FALSE otherwise.

members.member:
The editor control with the basic functionality. This is the main control.
The main assembly has a satellite contract attribute to unlink the version relation between the main and the satellite assemblies. You should set all new satellites always to "1.0.0.0" to make the resource manager operate properly, even if the version of the main assembly is much higher.
To instantiate the control just call the constructor:
using GuruComponents.Netrix;
HtmlEditor htmlEditor1 = new HtmlEditor(); // do some stuff with the editor here A basic application to implement a HTML editor solution must provide these functions:
An instance of the component.
The ReadyStateComplete event attached to a handler.
A handler which sets the control into design mode on request.
After having this the user can put the control into design mode and the application can look for the ready state complete event. It is important that no function is called before this event was fired.
Take a look at the various methods and properties to see more examples of how to use it.

The argument. Supported types are string, bool, int and short.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetCurrentScopeElement
member.summary: Get the current element which is in the scope for next editing operation.
member.remarks:
Caller can cast the object to the right IElement derived type.
If it's more important to get the current element, which has fired the last event or is set by event, it's better to use the method. Under normal circumstances both method return the same element, but during key or mouse operations in nested element hierarchies there might be a difference between currency and scope.
member.returns: The element object

member.remarks: This method returns the current element, as it is set by event. If the element wasn't recognized for some reason the method returns the Body Element
member.returns: The current element object.

member.summary: Searches the element tree upwards to detect the next element the current element is in.
member.remarks: Search stops and fails if body is reached ==> element is not in document tree. Search returns the first occurence of element, therefore the innermost element of a nested structure is recognized.
member.param: IElement element or null if not found.
The tag name which the methods searches for.
member.returns: Returns the element, if found.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.RegisterNamespace(System.String,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers a namespace.
member.remarks: Registered Namespaces will call the behaviorfactory for that namespace. The behaviorfactory uses a callback delegate to find the drawing method to draw and resolve the element and, additionally, the ViewLink content used to display the element. Both, drawing and embedding, must implemented separatly by the host application.
member.param: The alias of the namespace, like "asp" for ASP.NET controls.
URN of namespace
The type of behavior the namespace manager uses to resolve elements for rendering. Must inherit from IBaseBehavior.

member.remarks: Registered Namespaces will call the behaviorfactory for that namespace. member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.RegisterElement(GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.Elements.ITagInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers an element for internal processing.
member.remarks:
The type class must have a public constructor which must accept exact one parameter of type IHTMLElement. Once the element is registered, the control tries to get the constructor, instantiate an object and return the object to the caller. Some of the events the control fires use these generic object creation to expose native element objects to the host application.
To obtain the ITagInfo object instantiate it using the ITagInfo class or any class which implements ITagInfo. When creating an ITagInfo object for elements which resides in a specific namespace, one must include the namespace alias which registered whithin the control. The namespace must have been registered before the first element is added.
The type the element object is created from must implement IElement.
member.param: The formatting information.
The type of element.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.InvokeCommand(System.ComponentModel.Design.CommandID)
member.summary: Sends a command to the editor.
member.remarks: Extender and plug-ins can register there private commands by adding them using . The host application can then call these commands by using this method.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.HideCaret
member.summary: The HideCaret function removes the caret from the screen.
member.remarks: Hiding a caret does not destroy its current shape or invalidate the insertion point.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ShowCaret
member.summary: The ShowCaret function makes the caret visible on the screen at the caret's current position.
member.remarks:
When the caret becomes visible, it begins flashing automatically. ShowCaret shows the caret only if the specified window owns the caret, the caret has a shape, and the caret has not been hidden two or more times in a row. If one or more of these conditions is not met, ShowCaret does nothing and returns false.
Hiding is cumulative. If your application calls HideCaret five times in a row, it must also call ShowCaret five times before the caret reappears.
The system provides one caret per queue. A window should create a caret only when it has the keyboard focus or is active. The window should destroy the caret before losing the keyboard focus or becoming inactive. In NetRix this is the default behavior and there is no need to manipulate the caret directly but a different behavior is required.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.PrintWithPreview
member.summary: Shows the print preview and let the user optionally print.
member.remarks: To use the print feature the control must be able to reload the current content internally. Therefore the host application must provide a path or URL to the LoadXXX methods before a printing process can start. Without a valid path the print command is ignored and the preview will display a blank page.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.PrintWithPreview(System.String)
member.summary: Prints a document using a customized preview from the given print template.
member.remarks: To use the print feature the control must be able to reload the current content internally. Therefore the host application must provide a path or URL to the LoadXXX methods before a printing process can start. Without a valid path the print command is ignored and the preview will display a blank page.
member.param: The path to the HTML code creating the print template.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.PrintImmediately
member.summary: Print the current document to the current printer without any user interaction.
member.remarks: To use the print feature the control must be able to reload the current content internally. Therefore the host application must provide a path or URL to the LoadXXX methods before a printing process can start. Without a valid path the print command is ignored and the method will print a blank page.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SendIDMCommand(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method sends an IDM command directly to MSHTML.
member.remarks:
The call is protected by a try/catch block. The method does not throw an exception on error and does always return nothing. This method is just for experimental environments and should not used in production environments.
This is method is subject to be changed or removed in later versions without further notice.

Note: The appereance in this list does not mean that a particular command works either in NetRix or MSHTML. Additionally, some commands expect parameters which are currently not supported by this method.
member.param: The IDM command ID sent to the control.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of element objects which contains all element with the given tag name.
member.remarks: If no such elements the method will return null.
member.param: The name of the specific tag which the method should search.
member.returns: The of objects or null, if no elements found.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the element with the given Id as native element object.
member.param: The ID value which the method should search for.
member.returns: The element, if found or null, if there is no such element.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetAllElements
member.summary: Returns all element of the current page.
member.returns: The collection of all elements.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetBodyElement
member.summary: Returns the current BodyElement object from the document.
member.returns: BodyElement, if any or null if no body is present or document is not ready.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetFullPathUrl
member.summary: Gets the full decoded path to the file this document is load locally from.
member.remarks: This can be an URL, but under most circumstances this may be a Path. Any monikers of type "file://" are removed.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Copy
member.summary: Copy the current selection.
member.remarks: The command does nothing if the property returns false.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Cut
member.summary: Cut the current selection
member.remarks: The command does nothing if the property returns false.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Paste
member.summary: Cut the current selection.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Delete
member.summary: Delete the current selection.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches and replaces a string.
member.param: String to search for
String to replace with
true if case sensitive
true if only whole words (search string matches word boundaries) found
true if search upwards, false otherwise
member.returns: Number of replaces

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches and replaces a string.
member.param: String to search for
String to replace with
true if case sensitive
true if only whole words (search string matches word boundaries) found
true if search upwards, false otherwise
Maximum number of replacments.
member.returns: Number of replaces

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ReplaceSelection(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the current selection with a new string.
member.remarks:
The string can have any length. An empty string is allowed. The method will do nothing if there is no valid text selection.
If the selection contains tags or block elements they will be replaced, too. If this results in invalid HTML the method can fire an exception or produce unpredictable results. It is strongly recommended to read and to see the current content of the selection and start replacement only if applicable.
member.param: The string which replaces the current selection.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ReplaceNext(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces the next occurence of the give string.
member.remarks: This method does not fire any events. After the replacement takes place the method ends. There is no information whether the replacement was successful. The purpose of this method is to interact with .
member.param: String to search for
String to replace with
true if case sensitive
true if only whole words (search string matches word boundaries) found
true if search upwards, false otherwise
member.returns: Number of replaces

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for a text string in the whole document.
member.remarks: Searches document for a given string and, if the string was found, returns true. The search stops at the first hit and starts from the last stop. Subsequent calls jump from hit to hit. The document will automatically scroll to the marked position.
member.param: A string to search for.
Must be set to true if match case is required.
Must set to true if only whole words should be found.
Must set to true to search backwards.
member.returns: Returns true if something was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ClearDirtyState
member.summary: Reset the dirty state flag to inform the control that the current state is used as unchanged state.
member.remarks: This may result in removing the Undo history under some circumstances.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SetAuthentication(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets username and password four silent authentication on protected sites.
member.remarks: If these parameters are set the control tries to authenticate using these values if a site requests authentication. This in fact suppresses the typical authentication dialog. After changing the values it is necessary to call LoadHtml or LoadUrl again.
member.param: The username the control should send on request.
The password the control should send on request.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ClearAuthenticationCache
member.overloads: There are two overloads of this method.
member.summary: This method resets the current credentials applied to the control.
member.remarks: After successfull authentication to a secure site the control will reuse the credentials on any further access. To avoid this and to re-force the authentication, a call to this method is applicable. Calling this method will not reset the username and password set with SetAuthentication.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ClearAuthenticationCache(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method resets the current credentials applied to the control and remove the username and password.
member.remarks: After successfull authentication to a secure site the control will reuse the credentials on any further access. To avoid this and to re-force the authentication, a call to this method is applicable. Calling this method will clear the username and password set with SetAuthentication. Further calls to a protected site will always fail if no new username and password beeing set before.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetRawHtml
member.summary: Retrieves the HTML contained in control to a string and return it.
member.remarks:
The content is unchanged "as is" the MSHTML control provides it.
This method returns always the content of the base document. In case of a framed document this is the document containing the frameset definitions. The host application must use the HtmlFrameSet and related objects to call the save methods there to save the content of each frame document separatly.
member.returns: The HTML in the control

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetRawHtml(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the HTML contained in control to a string and return it.
member.remarks:
The content is unchanged "as is" the MSHTML control provides it.
This method returns always the content of the base document. In case of a framed document this is the document containing the frameset definitions. The host application must use the HtmlFrameSet and related objects to call the save methods there to save the content of each frame document separatly.
member.param: If set to true the call of this method will reset the IsDirty flag.
member.returns: The HTML in the control

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.GetRawHtml(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the HTML contained in control to a string and return it.
member.remarks:
The content is unchanged "as is" the MSHTML control provides it.
This method returns always the content of the base document. In case of a framed document this is the document containing the frameset definitions. The host application must use the HtmlFrameSet and related objects to call the save methods there to save the content of each frame document separatly.
member.param: If set to true the call of this method will reset the IsDirty flag.
If set to true, the currently active frame is the source, otherwise the frame definition document. This parameter is ignored, if the document has no frames.
member.returns: The HTML in the control

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveFile
member.summary: Saves the content as a file to the location the content was previously loaded from.
member.remarks: The method checks whether the file already exists and tries to create the file if it does not exist. The name of the method is used as a file name. If the path does not point to a filesystem with write permissions an exception occurs.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveFile(System.String)
member.summary: Save the current content into a file.
member.remarks:
This method saves the "raw" content which consists of unformatted HTML. This method requires Write access to the file. The file will be created if it doesn't exists.
The method checks whether the file already exists and tries to create the file if it does not exist. The name of the method is used as a file name. If the path does not point to a filesystem with write permissions an exception occurs.
member.param: The filename optionally including the full path.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveFile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the current "raw" content into a stream. The stream is not closed and remains open.
member.param: The stream the content is written into.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveHtml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the HTML contained in the control to a stream.
member.remarks: Throws an if the parameter is null. Uses the global Encoding property for document encoding.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveFormattedHtml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the HTML contained in the control to a stream using the default formatter.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveFormattedHtml(System.IO.Stream,GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions)
member.summary: Saves the HTML contained in the control to a stream.
member.remarks:
Throws an if the parameter is null. Uses the global Encoding property for document encoding. Another method uses the GetRawHtml or GetFormattedHtml methods, which return content of the editor as string. It is up to the host application to use the common .NET file classes to save the content. The class HtmlFormatterOptions provides a way to control the beautifier and formatter. The various properties are:
IndentChar
IndentSize
MaxLineLength
AsXhtml
ElementCasing
AttributeCasing
Note: Both save methods throw an ArgumentNullException if the stream parameter is null. If it is possible that the stream is null under some circumstances, we should put a try/catch block around the call.
HtmlFormatterOptions
member.exception: Fired if stream parameter is null.
member.param: for formatting this streams content.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveMht(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the previously loaded content as MHTML stream.
member.remarks:
If the file does not exist the method will create it. If the file exists the method will overwrite it.
The main idea of the MHTML standard is that you send a HTML document, together with in-line graphics, applets, etc., and also other linked documents if you so wish, in a MIME multipart/related body part. The content of the HTML part is coded in quoted printable format. The images and binary objects are coded in Base64, always chunked in segments to 76 characters per line.
The IE can save and view MHTML. The preferred extension is MHT. NetRix works similiar to the basic MHTML save routine, but does not use the internal interfaces.
Attention: The method returns the content as it if was loaded the first time. ANY CHANGE DURING DESIGNTIME IS NOT RECOGNIZED. To save the current content the host application MUST save and reload the content AND wait for the next ReadyStateComplete event before this method can work properly.
Know Issues: This method is EXPERIMENTAL. It does not save frames properly and it does not handle local absolute paths correctly.
member.param: The full path the content is saved into.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveMht(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the previously loaded content as MHTML stream.
member.remarks:
If the file does not exist the method will create it. If the file exists the method will overwrite it.
The main idea of the MHTML standard is that you send a HTML document, together with in-line graphics, applets, etc., and also other linked documents if you so wish, in a MIME multipart/related body part. The content of the HTML part is coded in quoted printable format. The images and binary objects are coded in Base64, always chunked in segments to 76 characters per line.
The IE can save and view MHTML. The preferred extension is MHT. NetRix works similiar to the basic MHTML save routine, but does not use the internal interfaces.
The method fails if the document is not ready yet.
Attention: The method returns the content as it if was loaded the first time. ANY CHANGE DURING DESIGNTIME IS NOT RECOGNIZED. To save the current content the host application MUST save and reload the content AND wait for the next ReadyStateComplete event before this method can work properly.
Know Issues: This method is EXPERIMENTAL. It does not save frames properly and it does not handle local absolute paths correctly.
member.param: A stream (primarily a FileStream) to which the content is saved.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SaveMht
member.summary: Saves the previously loaded content as MHTML string.
member.remarks:
Be aware that the string contains the page and all embedded resources as one block of coded data. This is approximatly 33% more than the sum of all file sizes (due to the Base64 coding). A normal page can produce a huge string and the processing may take a while.
The main idea of the MHTML standard is that you send a HTML document, together with in-line graphics, applets, etc., and also other linked documents if you so wish, in a MIME multipart/related body part. The content of the HTML part is coded in quoted printable format. The images and binary objects are coded in Base64, always chunked in segments to 76 characters per line.
The IE can save and view MHTML. The preferred extension is MHT. NetRix works similiar to the basic MHTML save routine, but does not use the internal interfaces.
Attention: The method returns the content as it if was loaded the first time. ANY CHANGE DURING DESIGNTIME IS NOT RECOGNIZED. To save the current content the host application MUST save and reload the content AND wait for the next ReadyStateComplete event before this method can work properly.
Know Issues: This method is EXPERIMENTAL. It does not save frames properly and it does not handle local absolute paths correctly.
member.returns: The string to which the content was written or null, if there is no content or the document is not ready.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ReLoadHtml(System.String)
member.summary: This method replaces the content of the whole designer.
member.remarks: The relation to the previously loaded URL or filename is left untouched. The content is also beeing rewritten to the file and reloaded from that location. This assures that the paths to relative embedded objects are still valid. ReLoadHtml
member.param: Content which replaces the current content

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ReLoadUrl(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method replaces the content of the whole designer.
member.remarks:
This is the preferred methos to refresh the content. If the content was externally changed, it is necessary to save the content before the reload takes place. If saving is not done, the old content will replace all changes.
It is up to the host application to decide where to save the content. If the parameter saveContent is set to true, the component will save the content internally and overwrite the original file without further questions.
member.exception: Thrown if the path is not valid or not a file.
member.param: Content which replaces the current content

If true, the component will save the the current content to file and reload from file then. If false the component will load the last not saved content from the related URL. This means, that any unsaved content will be lost. There is no UNDO on this action available.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ReLoadUrl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method simply refreshes the content to rebuild all relations, like linked stylesheets.
member.remarks: A call to this method can force the save operation on request.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.LoadUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Loads HTML content from a URL or local path.
member.remarks:
This is the preferred load method. It can take HTML content from the following sources:
A locally stored file
An URL, with the leading "http://" (required)
The method will fire the Loading before the load process starts, but not when the URL or filename was not accepted. This can be used to check the processing, e.g. if the event does not fire the URL is wrong or the filename was not found. If the processing is done the Loaded event will fired. Remember that the next editing command MUST wait until the ReadyStateComplete was fired, which takes a bit more time used by the control to render and display of the content.
Use LoadHtml to load memory based strings only.
If MSHTML has not yet been created, the loading is postponed until MSHTML has been created. The method uses internally IMoniker to set the current base path to resolve relative paths in src and href attributes without changing the parameters.
member.param: URL (http://any.domain.com/file.html) or file (C:\whatever\path\file.html) to load from.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.LoadFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a local file into the control.
member.remarks: This method is simply a wrapper for . It checks the existence of the file on the local system and loads it if possible.
member.exception: Fires this exception if the file was not found.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.LoadDocx(System.String)
member.summary: Load a DOCX document into the editor. EXPERIMENTAL.
member.remarks:
The document is read, unpacked, transformed and loaded as string into HTML. The control exposes and writes content back as HTML.
Some features are not properly supported. EXPERIMENTAL.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.LoadHtml(System.IO.FileStream)
member.summary: Loads HTML content from a stream into this control.
member.remarks:
It is recommended to use a FileStream for that procedure, because internally the name is extracted from the file name of the underlying stream. Otherwise any stream is possible which can be used with the StreamReader class. The method will fire the Loading before the load process starts, but not when the URL or filename was not accepted. This can be used to check the processing, e.g. if the event does not fire the URL is wrong or the filename was not found. If the processing is done the Loaded event will fired. Remember that the next editing command MUST wait until the ReadyStateComplete was fired, which takes a bit more time used by the control to render and display of the content.
If MSHTML has not yet been created, the loading is postponed until MSHTML has been created. The method uses internally IMoniker to set the current base path to resolve relative paths in src and href attributes without changing the parameters.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.LoadHtml(System.String)
member.summary: Loads HTML content from a string into this control.
member.remarks:
If previously used stream or file load process was used the existing URL (e.g. the filename) remains. If in a previous operation was no name set the default name "localhost" was set. The method will fire the Loaded before the load process starts, but not when the URL or filename was not accepted. This can be used to check the processing, e.g. if the event does not fire the URL is wrong or the filename was not found. If the processing is done the Loading event will fired. Remember that the next editing command MUST wait until the ReadyStateComplete was fired, which takes a bit more time used by the control to render and display of the content.
If MSHTML has not yet been created, the loading is postponed until MSHTML has been created. The method uses internally IMoniker to set the current base path to resolve relative paths in src and href attributes without changing the parameters.
This method will set the control into non file based mode, as there is no filename provided.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ImeReconversion
member.summary: Allows computer users to employ IME reconversion while browsing Web pages.
member.remarks:
During initialization, the host can set this flag to enable Input Method Editor (IME) reconversion, allowing computer users to employ IME reconversion while browsing Web pages. An input method editor is a program that allows users to enter complex characters and symbols, such as Japanese Kanji characters, using a standard keyboard.
Note: This features is available as of NetRix Pro 1.6. It's not available in Advanced or Standard.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ThreadSafety
member.summary: Turns on thread safe access to properties and methods.
member.remarks: By default the component isn't thread safe. However, the burdensome Invoke technique required to invoke cross thread calls is implemented internally and can be turned on or off using this property. The drawback is that permanent access in a threadsafe manner could result in the performance flaw. In case nobody needs cross thread access it's recommended to let this property set to false.

member.remarks: This method allows the editor to behave differently if the user hits the Enter key. By default, enter inserts a new paragraph. If this property is true, the Enter key will insert a break (BR tag). The opposite insertion method, Shft-Enter, will insert a paragraph. The type of paragraph depends on the the current setting.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.Version

member.remarks: This property returns the current assembly version to inform during design session about the assembly loaded.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.SerialNumberPrefix
member.summary: Returns the current serial number prefix the control was licensed with.
member.remarks:
This gives the developer access to the type of control and license the control was compiled with during run time. The prefix contains information about the control type and kind of license in the following format:
XXTCCTK / 7 digits, numeric
The digits have the following meaning:
XX: always 33 (Code for the Genesis Series at Guru Components)
T: 9 for full version, 0 for trial
CC: always 44 (Code for the NetRix Control and Component Series)
K: Control key (1=Full, 2=Light, 3=ColorPicker, 4=FontPicker, 5=StylEditor, 6=UnitEditor)
The host application can look for the specific value and operate differently depending on the used control type and license. For example, you can produce a demo version of your product with the trial license of NetRix which expires exactly one day before the NetRix license expires to avoid the license exception thrown from the license manager.
Note: The prefix does not contain secret information about the key or your serial number. If an user retrieves the prefix from the control he cannot activate or retrieve your license.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ServiceProvider
member.summary: Returns the service provider to provide common .NET services to plug-ins.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.CurrentCulture
member.summary: Sets or gets the current Culture.
member.remarks: Setting a different culture will load the language from NetRix.Localization.dll satellite DLL, which should contain the strings and images for that culture. If the culture does not exists there the default culture "en-US" will load. Once the resource is loaded, we store it in a static field to make it accessible to all classes which does not derive from HtmlEditor.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.StopFocusOnLoad
member.summary: If set to true the focus will not set on load.
member.remarks:
The default behavior of the focus will set the focus on the control and activates the caret after loading a document or HTML. This property suppresses this behavior if set.
It is important to set (or let) this property to false, if content is loaded, which has client side scripts in it or which has forms where the user can enter values. If the document cannot receive the focus, the user cannot enter anything, the content is totally blocked.
The intention of this property is to allow the subsequential re-loading of the content using whereas the user enters data into another control on the form. If, under any circumstances, the user is allows to enter anything or copy anything from the control, the property must turned off (set to false again.
This property was introduced in the second edition of the 1016 Build, June 8, 2004. The normal behavior was not changed if the property is not set explicitly and the control runs in design mode. In browse mode the control runs with getting the focus, unless this property is explicitly set.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.AutoUrlModeEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the automatic detection of URL and eMail addresses during text editing.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.LiveResize
member.summary: Causes the editor to update an element's appearance continuously during a resizing or moving operation, rather than updating only at the completion of the move or resize.
member.remarks: When this feature is off, an element's new position or size is indicated by a dashed rectangle until the mouse button is released. AbsolutePositioningEnabled Grid MultipleSelectionEnabled

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.MultipleSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Indicates if multiple selection is enabled in the editor.
member.remarks: Implicitly places MSHTML into multiple selection mode if set to true. This selection mode applies only if the control is in absolute positioning mode. To enter this mode just set the property AbsolutePositioningEnabled. Internally the control uses style sheets to enable HTML beeing absolute positioned. AbsolutePositioningEnabled Grid

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.AbsolutePositioningEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables absolute position for the entire editor.
member.remarks: Internally the control uses style sheets to enable HTML beeing absolute positioned. After moving positionable elements (IMG, TABLE, DIV, ...) the style "position:absolute" will be applied. If a position could be retrieved the "top" and "left" style attributes are set. Switching this property off will not remove the position information nor move the elements. After an element is first time moved with the mouse with AbsolutePositioningEnabled is off, the style "position:absolute" wil be removed. The position information will still left in the style attribute. If the property will be activated later, the style "position:absolute" is added again and the elements jump back to there previous position after the mouse touches them. MultipleSelectionEnabled Grid

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.KeepSelection

member.remarks: This property is useful for applications that require multiple control instances to interact with each other. One example is an e-mail application that allows users to select from a list of e-mails in one control instance and to see the actual e-mail in a second instance.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.IsFrameDocument
member.summary: Gets true if the current document is a frame document.
member.remarks: The purpose of this property is to detect the frame state of the document and switch appropriate UI elements on or off. Internally the property simply checks the number of frames. Therefore the property may return false, even if the document is a frame document with just zero frames. Developery of application which use frames extensivly may double check the content using method and XPath to see the real content of the base document.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.HtmlFrames
member.summary: Returns an object containing all Frame information.

remarks.para: Works only if the base document of a frameset. If the document contains a body this getter is still active and usable, but the framecollection is null. After retrieving successfully the frame object it can used to manipulate or create framesets. If the current document is a standard document and a new frame structure is build, the content will depraved and replaced by a new empty frameset.
The documentation of for more information about manipulation framesets.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.VerticalScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets the vertical scroll position.
member.remarks: The vertical scroll position is the distance from the document top to the current visible top border, measured in pixel. If the scrollbar is at the top position, this value is 0.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.HorizontalScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets the horizontal scroll position.
member.remarks: The horizontal scroll position is the distance from the document left to the current visible left border, measured in pixel. If the scrollbar is at the left position, this value is 0.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.ActivationEnabled
member.summary: Gets/Sets if the control can receive the focus.
member.remarks: The purpose of the property is to temporarily hook of the control from the TAB list of controls.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.IsReady
member.summary: Indicates if the control is ready for use.

remarks.para: If the document was a frameset, the complete handling is done in HtmlFrameSet class. This class can set the IsReady property exclusivly to true, if the frame document is ready. This assures that subsequent calls / events used from the base classes, like work properly as they normally throw exceptions if methods are called for an unready document.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.IsDirty
member.summary: Indicates if the contents of the editor have been modified.
member.remarks:
This flag is set to false after a document or document fragment wss loaded. It becomes true after the first change in the documents structure or content. Moving the caret or clicking objects without moving them wil not set the flag to dirty state.
The flag will be reset on each save operation. This is done by calling the RawHtml content by any of the methods SaveHtml or SaveFormattedHtml. Whereas the SaveXXX methods really write content into a stream the GetRawHtml or GetFormattedHtml, method just returns the content to the caller. Both method are overloaded and provide a second parameter to force resetting the dirty flag. If this is done the host application should assure that the content is really saved, to keep the flag and the UI synchronized.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.InternalShortcutKeys
member.summary: Activates or deactivates the internal shortcut keys.
member.remarks:
If the property is on (default), the following keys are static assigned:
Key
Description
Design Mode Only
Ctrl-A
Select all
-
Ctrl-C
Copy selected text
-
Ctrl-P
Print immediately using internal dialogs.
-
Ctrl-U
Underline
+
Ctrl-B
Bold
+
Ctrl-I
Italic
+
Ctrl-L
Align Left (Block only)
+
Ctrl-R
Align Right (Block only)
+
Ctrl-J
Justify (Multiline Block only)
+
Ctrl-V
Paste
+
Ctrl-X
Cut
+
Ctrl-Y
Redo
+
Ctrl-Z
Undo
+
The property can be turned on and off during run time and will become active immediately.
To strip out specific keys you can handle the BeforeShortcut event and set the Cancel property to true to disable the internal key handling. The same event can be used to assign more Shortcut keys in your application, because the event is fired on every kex in combination with the Ctrl (Control) key, even if the key stroke is not handled elsewhere.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.XPTheming
member.summary: Controls the way the component renders themeable controls.
member.remarks:
Buttons, Select boxes and other form elements can be rendered during design time using XP themes, if the application runs on XP. If the designer is used to design pages which run later on other operating systems, it is recommended to switch theming support of.
The default value is true (Theming is on).

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.BlockDefault
member.summary: Sets how paragraphs will be inserted, DIV or P tags.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.AllowInPlaceNavigation
member.summary: Set the behavior of links in browse mode.
member.remarks:
If this property is set to true an the user clicks a link in browse mode the new page will load internally and replace the current page. If set to false the link will start a new instance of Internet Explorer (or the systems default browser) and opens the link externally. Any further navigation operations are no longer under the control of NetRix.
This option is not recognized in design mode.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.IsFullDocumentMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to determine full document mode.
member.remarks:
The full document mode forces the basic structure of the loaded HTML document to this one:
<html> <body> <!-- your HTML fragment goes here --> </body> </html>
To avoid this behavior just set this property to false and reload the document.
Changing this property during an editing session will not be recognized.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.DocumentDom
member.summary: Returns the DOM (document object model) of the current loaded document.
member.remarks:
The property may return null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the document is either not ready or doesn't contain a HTML element.
After first call the reference to the object is being cached, so a direct and extensive access using this property does not cause a performance flaw. Any LoadXXX method will reset cache and the first subsequent call will recreate the new document structure. Changes to the document are reflected synchrounously.
ElementDom interface.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor.IsFileBasedDocument
member.summary: Determines that the document is loaded from and saved into a file.
member.remarks: This property is set automatically if the document is loaded from an URL or file using the methods. If the methods are used, the host application can determine how the load/save process works. To work with files the property is set to true. This is the default value. To work without any file relation, the property should set to false, before issuing a method to load content.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IElementStyle
member.summary: IStyle gives interactive access to each property of a style rule.
member.remarks:
CssStyle class implements IStyle interface. A style definition is either an inline style (attribute style of any stylable element) or the definition part of a style rule. A rule is a combination of a descriptor and a style.
The purpose of this class is to have an isolated store for CSS definitions. This behaves slightly different from the styles defined as part of the elements. The native class CssStyle allows access to style definitions using the PropertyGrid and not the NetRix StyleEditor.
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IElementStyle.color
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the color of the text of the object.
member.remarks:
Some browsers do not recognize color names, but all browsers should recognize RGB color values and display them correctly. Therefore the property returns always RGB values, even if the value was previously set using names. This is a different behavior compared to the original MSHTML.
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IElementStyle.cursor
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the type of cursor to display as the mouse pointer moves over the object.

list.item: Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle, indicating that the page can be scrolled in any direction.
Default. Browser determines which cursor to display based on the current context.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them, indicating that the item/column can be resized horizontally.
Platform-dependent default cursor; usually an arrow.
Hand with the first finger pointing up, as when the user moves the pointer over a link.
Arrow with question mark, indicating help is available.
Crossed arrows, indicating something is to be moved.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Hand with a small circle with a line through it, indicating that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Circle with a line through it, indicating that the requested action will not be carried out.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Hand with the first finger pointing up, as when the user moves the pointer over a link. Identical to hand.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrow with an hourglass next to it, indicating that a process is running in the background. User interaction with the page is unaffected.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them, indicating that the item/row can be resized vertically.

Internet Explorer 6 and later. Cursor is defined by the author, using a custom Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), such as url('mycursor.cur'). Cursors of type .CUR and .ANI are the only supported cursor types.
Internet Explorer 6 and later. Editable vertical text, indicated by a horizontal I-bar.
Hourglass or watch, indicating that the program is busy and the user should wait.
Arrows, indicating an edge is to be moved; the asterisk (*) can be N, NE, NW, S, SE, SW, E, or Wâ€”each representing a compass direction.

remarks.para: See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IElementStyle.display
member.summary: Sets or retrieves whether the object is rendered.
member.remarks:
In Internet Explorer 4.0, the block, inline, and list-item values are not supported explicitly, but do render the element.
The block and inline values are supported explicitly as of Internet Explorer 5.
In Internet Explorer 5.5 and earlier, the default value of this property for LI elements is block.
The inline-block value is supported as of Internet Explorer 5.5. You can use this value to give an object a layout without specifying the object's height or width.
All visible HTML objects are block or inline. For example, a div object is a block element, and a span object is an inline element. Block elements typically start a new line and can contain other block elements and inline elements. Inline elements do not typically start a new line and can contain other inline elements or data. Changing the values for the display property affects the layout of the surrounding content by:
Adding a new line after the element with the value block.
Removing a line from the element with the value inline.
Hiding the data for the element with the value none.
In contrast to the visibility property, display = none reserves no space for the object on the screen.
The table-header-group and table-footer-group values can be used to specify that the contents of the tHead and tFoot objects are displayed on every page for a table that spans multiple pages.
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IElementStyle.filter
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the filter or collection of filters applied to the object.

remarks.para: An object must have layout for the filter to render. A simple way to accomplish this is to give the element a specified height and/or width. However, there are several other properties that can give an element layout. For more information on these other properties, see the hasLayout property.
The shadow filter can be applied to the img object by setting the filter on the image's parent container.

The filter mechanism is extensible and enables you to develop and add additional filters later. For more information about filters, see Introduction to Filters and Transitions on MSDN (online connection required).
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.remarks: See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.summary: Determines the z-order in which the binary behavior will drawn against the underlying element.

member.summary: The behavior draws after the element and all its child elements are drawn.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.HtmlZOrder.AboveFlow

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.Events.BeforeShortcutEventArgs
member.summary: This class defines data for the BeforeShortcut.
member.remarks:
This class can be used to catch and cancel a shortcut. A shortcut is in NetRix any key pressed in design or browse mode together with the control (Ctrl) key.
NetRix provides a few hardwired shortcuts. If you don't wish the internal processing you can disable the hardwired keys globally by using the InternalShortcutKeys property. To cancel onyl specific shortcut keys add a handler for the BeforeShortcut event and set the property Cancel property to true. Remember, that the handler is called for any control-key combination, even if they has no hardwired function assigned.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.Events.BeforeShortcutEventArgs.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Constructor for event arguments.
member.remarks: Used internally to support NetRix infrastructure. There is no need to call this constructor directly.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.Events.BeforeShortcutEventArgs.Key
member.summary: The key pressed as a shortcut key.
member.remarks: This is the base key, which the user has pressed together with the control key. Readonly.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.Events.BeforeShortcutEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets the current cancel state.
member.remarks: To cancel the internal processing of the currently pressed key just set the value to true in the event handler.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions
member.summary: Formatter options used to determine the overall behavior of the formatter class.
member.remarks: The formatter will analyse and refresh the content to beeing HTML 4/XHTML compliant. This changes the indentation, quotes and newlines. The formatter does not allow any code preservation.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.FakeEmptyParaTag
member.summary: Empty P Tags do not render properly in MSHTML. To fix this option adds   between.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.PreserveWhitespace
member.summary: Indicates whether whitespaces (space, newline, tab) should be preserved, if possible. Default is false.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.CommentCDATA
member.summary: Gets or sets the ability to add JavaScript comments before CDATA token.
member.remarks:
The XHTML module wraps JavaScript code into <![CDATA[ ]]> sections. Some script processors have problems reading this. To avoid any scripting issues this option can set to true and the formatter will add // sign in front of <![CDATA[ ]]>:
<script> //<![CDATA[ Script goes here //]]> </script>
Default setting is false (option not being used).
The used string for comment signs defaults to "//". The value can be changed using .

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.CommentCDATAString
member.summary: The string value used if the formatter needs to add comments before CDATA tokens.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.CommentCDATAAddsNewline
member.summary: After CDATA and before ending a newline is added autoamtically.
member.remarks: By default there is no newline added.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.WordClean
member.summary: Gets or sets the ability to clean MS Word styles.
member.remarks:
MS Word produces some weird output when content was saved as HTML. If such content was loaded or dropped this formatting feature can strip out the most of the non HTML 4/XHTML 1 compliant code.
The value defaults to false and must set explicitly.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.AttributeCasing
member.summary: Set the case of attributes. If true all attribute names are upper case.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.Entities
member.summary: If true (default) the entities are built as &name; variant, if any known entity exists. Otherwise any enhanced ASCII or unicode character will be replaced by the numeric expression &#NNN;.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.ElementCasing
member.summary: Set the case of element names. If true all element names are upper case.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.IndentChar
member.summary: Determines the char used to build indentation.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.IndentSize
member.summary: Determines the number of chars used for each indentation level. Use 1 for tabs and 4 to 8 for whitespace.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.MakeXhtml
member.summary: If true the output conforms to XHTML 1.0, otherwise to HTML 4.0 If input is XHTML compliant the output will never changed back to HTML 4.0 regardless this option.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.MaxLineLength
member.summary: Forces a line break after leaving the given number of columns per line.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions.ReformatStyles
member.summary: Reformats the CSS in attributes and style tags to remove unneccessary spaces. Default is false.

member.summary: Determines how the 'snap element' feature behaves against snapzones.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.SnapMode.Grid
member.summary: Snap element against grid. Doesn't matter if grid is visible or not.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.SnapMode.HelpLine
member.summary: Snap element agains helpline. Helpline must be visible to snap.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.SnapMode.Both
member.summary: Snap against both, grid and helpline.

member.name: F:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.SnapMode.None
member.summary: Turn off any snap behavior.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid
member.summary: Displays a grid of pixels to help positioning elements in absolute position mode.
member.remarks: Optionally implements SnapRect to snap new elements to grid borders. Gridsize defaults to 8.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.SnapZone
member.summary: Number of pixel the grid will snap.
member.remarks: If the grid is every 20 pixels and the zone is 5, the snap feature will work from pixel 15 to 25 on first column. The pixel between 25 and 35 on second column will not snap. If the zone is equally or greater than grid elements will always snap.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.SnapOnResize
member.summary: Snap will also work on element resize.
member.remarks: The property applies, too.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.GridLineVisualisation
member.summary: The visual appearance of lines, if used instead of points.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.GridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of lines if the grid is shown as lines or the width of crosses in case cross view.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.GridVisualisation
member.summary: The visual appearance of the grid.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.GridVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the grid.
member.remarks: The grid is a good base to build the VS.NET like GridLayout. SnapEnabled AbsolutePositioningEnabled MultipleSelectionEnabled

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.SnapEnabled
member.summary: Enables snap of elements to grid if absolute positioning is enabled.
member.remarks: In flow layout is this function useless, therefore this options activates grid mode, too.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the gap between pixels shown as grid.
member.remarks: Defaults to 8 for both width and height, if no value is set. Setting values lower than 8 will cause performance problems on large surfaces because to many point are plotted with any screen refresh.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Behaviors.IHtmlGrid.GridColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the grid pixel.
member.remarks: Defaults to Color.Black.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IStyle
member.summary: IStyle gives interactive access to each property of a style rule.
member.remarks:
CssStyle class implements IStyle interface. A style definition is either an inline style (attribute style of any stylable element) or the definition part of a style rule. A rule is a combination of a descriptor and a style.
The purpose of this class is to have an isolated store for CSS definitions. This behaves slightly different from the styles defined as part of the elements. The native class CssStyle allows access to style definitions using the PropertyGrid and not the NetRix StyleEditor.
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IStyle.clip
member.summary: Sets or retrieves which part of a positioned object is visible.

remarks.para: This property defines the shape and size of the positioned object that is visible. The Horizontalposition must be set to absolute. Any part of the object that is outside the clipping region is transparent. Any coordinate can be replaced by the value auto, which exposes the respective side (that is, the side is not clipped).
The order of the values rect(0 0 50 50) renders the object invisible because it sets the top and right positions of the clipping region to 0. To achieve a 50-by-50 view port, use rect(0 50 50 0).
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IStyle.color
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the color of the text of the object.
member.remarks:
Some browsers do not recognize color names, but all browsers should recognize RGB color values and display them correctly. Therefore the property returns always RGB values, even if the value was previously set using names. This is a different behavior compared to the original MSHTML.
See CssEffectiveStyle class for more details.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.IStyle.cssText
